TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit WebPermissionAttribute extends System.Security.Permissions.CodeAccessSecurityAttribute

Attribute.AttributeName: System.AttributeUsage(System.AttributeTargets.Assembly | System.AttributeTargets.Class | System.AttributeTargets.Struct | System.AttributeTargets.Constructor | System.AttributeTargets.Method, AllowMultiple=true, Inherited=false)

Docs.summary: Specifies permission to access Internet resources. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Net.WebPermissionAttribute> allows you to declaratively specify which URI strings and regular expression strings your class can use.
The security information specified in the <xref:System.Net.WebPermissionAttribute> is stored in the metadata of the attribute target, which is the class to which <xref:System.Net.WebPermissionAttribute> is applied. The system accesses this information at run time. The <xref:System.Security.Permissions.SecurityAction?displayProperty=fullName> passed to the constructor determines the allowable <xref:System.Net.WebPermissionAttribute> targets. The system uses the <xref:System.Net.WebPermission> returned by the <xref:System.Net.WebPermissionAttribute.CreatePermission%2A> method to convert the security information of the attribute target to a serializable form stored in metadata.
> [!NOTE] > <xref:System.Net.WebPermissionAttribute> is used only for [Declarative Security](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/97e21efd-6e89-4115-90d5-ad239513dad8). For [Imperative Security](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/15aab1e1-6b7d-41ad-b102-c1ed7bedea27), use the corresponding <xref:System.Net.WebPermission>.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to apply <xref:System.Net.WebPermissionAttribute> to a method.
[!code-cpp[WebPermissionAttribute_AcceptConnect#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebPermissionAttribute_AcceptConnect/CPP/webpermissionattribute_acceptconnect.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[WebPermissionAttribute_AcceptConnect#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebPermissionAttribute_AcceptConnect/CS/webpermissionattribute_acceptconnect.cs#1)] [!code-vb[WebPermissionAttribute_AcceptConnect#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebPermissionAttribute_AcceptConnect/VB/webpermissionattribute_acceptconnect.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a value that specifies the security actions that can be performed on this class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Security.Permissions.SecurityAction> value passed to this constructor specifies the allowable security actions that can be performed on this class.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to apply <xref:System.Net.WebPermissionAttribute> to a method.
[!code-cpp[WebPermissionAttribute_Constructor#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebPermissionAttribute_Constructor/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[WebPermissionAttribute_Constructor#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebPermissionAttribute_Constructor/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[WebPermissionAttribute_Constructor#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebPermissionAttribute_Constructor/VB/source.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the URI string accepted by the current .
Docs.value: A string containing the URI accepted by the current .

remarks.format:
## Remarks When applying <xref:System.Net.WebPermissionAttribute> to your class, this property specifies what URI string will be accepted for use within your class. This permission is applied when the security system calls <xref:System.Net.WebPermissionAttribute.CreatePermission%2A>. This property is write-once.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use <xref:System.Net.WebPermissionAttribute> to specify an allowable <xref:System.Net.WebPermissionAttribute.Accept%2A> string.
[!code-cpp[WebPermissionAttribute_Accept#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebPermissionAttribute_Accept/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[WebPermissionAttribute_Accept#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebPermissionAttribute_Accept/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[WebPermissionAttribute_Accept#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebPermissionAttribute_Accept/VB/source.vb#1)]

Docs.exception: is not when you attempt to set the value. If you wish to specify more than one Accept URI, use an additional attribute declaration statement.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a regular expression pattern that describes the URI accepted by the current .
Docs.value: A string containing a regular expression pattern that describes the URI accepted by the current . This string must be escaped according to the rules for encoding a constructor string.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When applying <xref:System.Net.WebPermissionAttribute> to your class, this property specifies what regular expression string will be accepted for use within your class. This property is write-once.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use <xref:System.Net.WebPermissionAttribute> to specify an allowable <xref:System.Net.WebPermissionAttribute.AcceptPattern%2A>.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the URI connection string controlled by the current .
Docs.value: A string containing the URI connection controlled by the current .

remarks.format:
## Remarks When applying <xref:System.Net.WebPermissionAttribute> to your class, this property specifies what URI connection is accepted for use within your class. This property is write-once.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use WebPermissionAttribute to specify an allowable <xref:System.Net.WebPermissionAttribute.Connect%2A> string.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a regular expression pattern that describes the URI connection controlled by the current .
Docs.value: A string containing a regular expression pattern that describes the URI connection controlled by this .

remarks.format:
## Remarks When applying <xref:System.Net.WebPermissionAttribute> to your class, this property specifies what regular expression connect string is accepted for use within your class. This property is write-once.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Security.IPermission CreatePermission() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates and returns a new instance of the class.
Docs.returns: A corresponding to the security declaration.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Net.SocketPermissionAttribute.CreatePermission%2A> method is called by the security system, not by application code.
The security information described by <xref:System.Net.WebPermissionAttribute> is stored in the metadata of the attribute target, which is the class to which <xref:System.Net.WebPermissionAttribute> is applied. The system accesses the information at run time. The system uses the <xref:System.Net.WebPermission> returned by <xref:System.Net.SocketPermissionAttribute.CreatePermission%2A> to convert the security information of the attribute target to a serializable form stored in metadata.
